text:
ROBERT L. PETERSON, assistant to director. Business Management
Service and administrative assistant, Provost*s OfficeÂ®
Peterson joined the staff of the Business Management
Service of the College of Commerce and Business Administration in
1950, continuing in his connection with the Provost*s Office one-third
time, Aitmibinaub having served as administrative assistant to the
Provost since 1948*
He receivedhis A.B. in 1945* and his M*A. in 194&*
both from George Washington University* He has since done additional
graduate work at New York University and at the University of Illinois*
Prom 1944-46 Petersen served as Personnel Officer in the
Division of Industrial Relations, Office of the Secretary of the
Navy, Washington, D.C. Prom 1946-1947 hew as in the Utilization
Department of Remington-Rand, NewYork, where he specialized in
office methods, systems, and procedures work* Upon joining the
University of Illinois staff in 1 946, he continued similar work
in the Provost*s Office, where he conducted a number of organizational
and utilization studies in University offices*
He is the author of several bulletins on office
procedures which have been published by the Business Management
Service. Another of his interests is geriatrics, the study of
aging, and he has conducted classes for older workers.
Peterson considers Enterprise, Kansas, as his
home town* He is married and lives at 1506 S. Orchard, Urbana.
-et-
